H0.text: Pebbles should be added to soil to increase its water retention.

H1.text: Sand is added to soil to increase its water retention.

H2.text: Rocks are added to soil to increase its water retention.

H3.text: Clay is added to soil to increase its water retention.

A4.text: clay soils are less suitable for crops due to their tendency to retain water.

A5.text: Some clay minerals (such as smectite) are described as swelling clay minerals, because they have a great capacity to take up water, and they increase greatly in volume when they do so.
